sentence.text: However, the biological function and mechanism of glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate biosynthetic process in cancer remain largely unknown.

In this study, we have found that glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate biosynthetic process expression was greatly decreased in clinical phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation samples, positively correlated with overall survival, and negatively associated with histological differentiation, tumor size and organ metastasis.
Moreover, overexpression of glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate biosynthetic process led to slowed tumor growth and decreased tumor weight inÂ vivo.

Therefore, our data suggested that glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate biosynthetic process functioned as a tumor suppressor in phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation and might serve as a potential therapeutic target for the treatment of HCC
